# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the function you asked for. This function takes a DataFrame and a DateTime column, then adds a new column to the DataFrame that combines the year and month from the DateTime into a single integer in the format "yyyymm". 

```julia
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame, dtcol::Symbol)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[dtcol])
end
```
This function uses the `map` function from DataFrames.jl to apply a function to each element in the specified column of the DataFrame. The function it applies takes a DateTime object and returns an integer that represents the year and month combined into "yyyymm" format. The function is defined as `(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x))`.

If you want to use this function, make sure to add `using DataFrames` at the beginning of your script if it's not already there.
